Action: Cancel current Find
Scroll by one full screen
Keystroke:
Scroll Down: Spacebar or Option–Down Arrow
Scroll Up: Shift–Spacebar or Option-Up Arrow

Action: Open Link in New Tab (in the background)
Open Link in New Tab (in the foreground)
Open Link in New Window
Add to Reading List
Send Message
Reply to Message
Reply All
Go to Inbox
Go to other mailboxes in your favorites bar
Prevent the next message from being automatically selected & marked as read
Search the current message
Search all messages
Compose a new email
Zoom In or Out
Zoom to Actual Size
Zoom to Fit
Force Quit (displayed list of apps)
Scroll using a Trackpad (like a mouse’s scroll wheel)
Right-click using a Trackpad (like on a 2 button mouse)
Keystroke: Place 2 fingers on the trackpad and Click

Action: Hide the current app
Hide all other apps (other than the current app)
Adjust the font size in Messages app
Quickly find any menu item and launch it.
Keystroke:
1. Press Cmd-Shift-/ (which is Cmd-? on the keyboard)
2. In the Help menu Search that opens, start typing a few letters of your desired menu command
3. Arrow key down to the item you want and press Return to choose it.

Action: If an app re-opens with the windows that were open when you last quit it, you can tell it not to re-open the windows.
Keystroke: Hold Shift while launching an app

Action: Turn off notifications (turn on Do Not Disturb)
Keystroke: Option-click the Notification Center icon in menu bar to toggle notifications off/on

Action: Change system volume in smaller increments
Change system volume with confirmation beeps
Keystroke: Hold Shift while changing volume (prior to Yosemite this would disable the beeps)

Action: Turn display mirroring on/off (when connected to an additional display)
Completely smooth scrolling, one pixel at a time (does not work in all apps)
Open “Sound” panel of System Preferences
Keystroke: Press Option and a Sound key (Mute, Volume Up or Down)

Action: Open “Displays” panel of System Preferences
Keystroke: Press Option and a Brightness key

Cmd drag icons to rearrange.
Cmd drag icon off toolbar to remove.
Ctrl-click toolbar and choose Customize for more options.

Action: Move the Terminal cursor with the mouse
Keystroke: Option–click where you’d like the cursor

Action: Change Terminal Directory to a specific folder (cd into the folder)
Keystroke: Cmd-Drag a folder onto the Terminal Window

Action: Go to start of line (move cursor to start of line)
Go to end of line (move cursor to end of line)
Go up one line
Go down one line
Go back a character (move cursor left)
Go forward a character (move cursor right)
Delete the character to the right of the cursor
Delete the character to the left of the cursor
Delete the selection or to the end of the line (acts like cutting the text)
Yank back the killed text (acts like pasting)
Scroll down
Center the current line in the window
Insert line break after the cursor without moving the cursor
Transpose letters (swaps letters on left and right of cursor)
Open Sidebar item in a new Tab or Window (depending on Finder Preferences)
Switch Finder views (Icon, List, Column, Gallery)
In List view, expand a folder
In List view, collapse a folder
Rename the selected file/folder
Go into selected folder or open the selected file
Go to parent folder
Go Back
Go Forward
Select the next icon in Icon and List views
Alternate columns in Column View
Resize one column to fit the longest file name (Column View)
Keystroke: Double-Click column divider (or the resize widget at the bottom of the column divider, depending on your setup)

Action: Resize all columns to fit their longest file names (Column View)
Keystroke: Option Double-Click column divider (or the resize widget at the bottom of the column divider, depending on your setup)

Action: Copy and Paste files
Copy and Paste files Exactly (Keeps original ownership & permissions. Requires Admin username & password.)
Cut and Paste files (Move files)
Copy a File's Pathname
Move a file instead of copying (Copies to the destination and removes it from the original disk.)
Immediately Delete a File (does not put file in Trash)
Move selected files to the Trash (called the Recycle Bin in Windows)
Empty the Trash with warning (like emptying Recycle Bin in Windows)
Empty the Trash with no warning (like emptying Recycle Bin in Windows)
Cancel a drag-n-drop action while in the midst of dragging
Show Inspector (a single, live refreshing Info window)
Undo the last action (such as rename file, copy file, etc.)
Toggle Hidden Files (Show Hidden Files or Hide Them). Also works in Open/Save dialogs!
Keystroke:
Cmd-Shift-Period(.)
May be a comma (,) instead of period for some languages.

Action: Hide/Show Sidebar (on the left)
Hide/Show Toolbar (on the top) and the Sidebar
Move or Remove item in toolbar (at the top of the window). Works in most programs.
Open Quick Look (Previews most types of files without having to open them)
Keystroke: Press the Spacebar (or Cmd-Y). On a trackpad can also tap with 3 fingers.

Action: Zoom In/Out in Quick Look (Images & PDFs)
Keystroke: Pinch on a trackpad or hold Cmd and hit + (plus) to zoom in or - (minus) to zoom out. Cmd–0 zooms back to fit in window.

Action: Find Files
Quickly switch between 2 apps (like Safari & Finder)
Keystroke:
Press Cmd-Tab to switch to last used app.
Press Cmd-Tab again to switch back.

Action: Switch between apps
Keystroke:
Press Cmd-Tab & continue holding Cmd. While holding Cmd, to choose which app you want to switch to:
press Tab (multiple times as needed) to scroll right
press Tilde(~) or Shift-Tab to scroll left
press Left/Right Arrow keys
aim with the mouse
press End/Home key to go to first/last app

Action: Quit an app in the app switcher
Keystroke: In the app switcher, you’re already holding Cmd, so hit Q to quit selected app.

Action: Hide an app in the app switcher
Keystroke: In the app switcher, you’re already holding Cmd, so hit H to hide selected app.

Action: Cancel the app switcher
Keystroke: In the app switcher, you’re already holding Cmd, so hit Esc or period(.)

Action: Switch to next window
Switch to previous window
See where the File/Folder is located (a menu will pop-up displaying the folder hierarchy). Works in most programs, including the Finder.
Keystroke: Cmd-Click on name of the window (in the titlebar)

Action: Move a window in the background without switching to it.
Choose “Don’t Save” in a Dialog
Keystroke: Cmd-D in some apps, but other apps use Cmd-Delete (Cmd-D will change the location to the Desktop)

Action: Hide all other apps (except the one you're clicking on)
Keystroke: Command-Option click an app’s icon in Dock

Action: Hide the app you’re leaving
Keystroke: Option click another app’s icon in Dock

Action: Reveal a Dock item’s location in the Finder
Keystroke: Command click on the icon in the Dock

Action: Force a file to open in a specific app
Keystroke: While dragging the file onto an app’s icon in the Dock, hold Command-Option

Action: In an App’s Dock menu change the Quit to Force Quit (Click & hold on an App in the Dock to show the menu)
Keystroke: Hold Option while in Dock menu

Action: Move Dock to left, bottom, right side of screen
Keystroke: Hold Shift and drag Dock divider

Action: Change the icon size of a stack (must be the grid view)
Temporarily turn magnification on/off
Force the Dock to only resize to non-interpolated icon sizes
Keystroke: Hold Option while dragging Dock separator

Action: Go to end of line
Go to beginning of line
Go to end of all the text
Go to beginning of all the text
Go to end of current or next word
Go to beginning of current or previous word
On Laptops: Delete Text to the right of the cursor (like the Del key on a full keyboard)
Non-touching (Discontinuous) text selections
Select non-linear areas
Delete entire word to the left
Paste and Match Style (so it looks the same as the text you are pasting into)
Look up word in dictionary
Keystroke: Mouse over a word and hit Cmd-Ctrl-D (Or on a trackpad use 3 fingers to tap on a word)

Action: Display Emoji pop-up
Keystroke: Command-Control-Space will open the Special Character panel. On the left you can select Emoji or other Symbols.

Action: Display Special/Alternate Characters
Keystroke: Hold any key. Example: Holding the “A” key will display à á â etc. You can press the corresponding number under the character you want to type to choose it (or arrow over to it).

Action: Auto completion word
Keystroke: Start typing the word. Press Option–Esc (or F5) to open suggested word list

Action: Switch to Outline Mode in TextEdit
Keystroke:
Press Option-Tab to convert the current line into a list item
Press Return to create another list item
Press Tab at the start of a blank list item to indent it, creating a sublist
Press Shift-Tab to remove a level of indention
Press Return twice to decrease the indent, exiting the current sublist/list

Action: Take a screenshot or screen recording (new in Mojave)
Take a screenshot of the entire screen
Take a screenshot of a selected area
Keystroke:
Cmd-Shift-4 and Drag over an area. While dragging:
Hold Spacebar to move selected area.
Hold Shift to change size in one direction only (horizontal or vertical)
Hold Option for center-based resizing.

Action: Take a screenshot of a specific window/object
Keystroke:
Cmd-Shift-4, then press Spacebar, then Click on the window/object.
TIP: Hold Option while you click to remove the drop shadow.

Action: Take a screenshot of the touch bar
Show Spotlight Search
Open Spotlight Finder Search Window
Launch Top Hit (in the Menu)
Reveal selected item in Finder
Keystroke:
In Spotlight Search: Press Cmd-Return
In Finder Window: Press Cmd-R

Action: Skip to first result in a category
Look up the definition of a word
Keystroke: Type the word in Spotlight’s search field and hit Cmd–L to look it up.

Action: Do a web search
Keystroke: Type something into Spotlight and hit Cmd–B to open it as a search in your web browser.

Action: Clear Spotlight Search
Keystroke:
Esc clears to do another search.
Esc a second time closes Spotlight.

Action: Enter Mission Control
Move to a neighboring space or full screen app
View Windows in the Current App
Show Desktop
Keystroke: F11 (may need to hold the fn button on some keyboards)

Action: Eject CD on boot
Keystroke: Hold Mouse button down immediately after powering on

Action: Safe boot
Start up in Recovery mode
Start up in Target Disk mode
Startup from a CD, DVD
Bypass primary startup volume and seek a different startup volume (CD, etc.)
Choose Startup disk before booting
Start up in Verbose mode
Start up in Single-User mode (command line)
Shutdown immediately (no confirmation)
Keystroke: Hold Cmd-Opt-Ctrl and press the Eject key or Power button

Action: Restart immediately (no confirmation)
Forced Restart (only do this when absolutely needed)
Sleep immediately (no confirmation)
Keystroke: Press the Power button (or hit Cmd-Opt-Eject)

Action: Show Dialog with Restart, Sleep & Shutdown Options
Keystroke: Hold Ctrl and press the Eject key or Power button (or hold the Power button for a few seconds and the dialog will appear)

Action: Put display to sleep
Keystroke: Hold Ctrl-Shift and press the Eject key or Power button

Action: Highlight URL/Search Field (at top of window)
Switch to Next Tab
Switch to Previous Tab
Switch tabs: jump directly to the first tab, second tab, etc. (If you change the preference, this will go to one of the first 9 bookmarks in the Bookmarks Bar.)
Move between found items
Keystroke:
Cmd-F, enter your search text and Press:
Return to Move Forward
Shift-Return to Move Backward
